tweet: b"From the US-Africa Leaders Summit, to Namibia, to the @gflaorg \xe2\x80\x93 I continue to be grateful for my friendship with @FirstLadyNam.\n\nMonica, you're a fierce advocate for women and girls in Namibia and beyond \xe2\x80\x93 thank you for raising your voice and helping fellow First Ladies do the\xe2\x80\xa6 https://t.co/rsmynAPrec https://t.co/Q8Lvw4asTx"

b'At the @gflaorg Summit, I had the opportunity to reunite with fellow First Ladies from the US-Africa Leaders Summit in December.\n\nIn these moments, we find hope, community, and inspiration in the bonds that connect us across oceans and continents. https://t.co/kh3c806fF5'

b'.@MayorGinther and @RepBeatty, thank you both for working with the Administration to strengthen pathways to good jobs.\n\nThe City of Columbus is an example of Bidenomics at the local level \xe2\x80\x93 Joe\xe2\x80\x99s vision to build the economy from the bottom up and the middle out. https://t.co/cQ90jcMghm'

b'RT @SecDef: Today we celebrate the 50th Anniversary of the All-Volunteer Force.\n\nOur nation\xe2\x80\x99s founding principles continue to inspire men a\xe2\x80\xa6'

Thank you \xe2\x80\x94 Joe and I are so proud of you. https://t.co/rfRcd4wnzj'

b'For the women whose lives are on the line, and for those who love them. https://t.co/aioo8ig9xx'

b"For the women whose health and lives are on the line, and for those who love them \xe2\x80\x94 know Joe's Administration is fighting to protect reproductive rights and calling upon Congress to make Roe v. Wade the law of the land once again."

b'Turned away from emergency rooms. Delayed treatments. Forced to travel. Mourning loss, while barely surviving the resulting infections.\n\nThese experiences shed light on how abortion bans take away a woman\xe2\x80\x99s ability to get the health care she needs.'

b'Since the Dobbs decision one year ago, far too many women have experienced devastating consequences to their health, their fertility, and their lives.\n\nToday, Anya, Austin, Nancy, and Elizabeth joined me at the White House to courageously share their stories. https://t.co/iJLcXELkiu'

b'Happy Father\xe2\x80\x99s Day to my dad \xe2\x80\x93 I can still imagine you sitting in your favorite chair to read the paper or flipping the TV channel to watch the Phillies game - you would have been proud of their season this year. Miss you, Dad. https://t.co/A2MkumwS64'
b'Joe, thank you for being the best dad to our kids. I love you, Happy Father\xe2\x80\x99s Day. https://t.co/KMvn12dTZI'

b'Happy 248th Birthday, @USArmy! https://t.co/ZI0HmskbGd'

b'Nothing like a little bit of sunshine and ice cream to celebrate Pride at the White House!\n\nTo all the LGBTQI+ families who joined us today and are celebrating across the country: Know that you belong, you are beautiful \xe2\x80\x94 and you are loved. https://t.co/pc4onKOP0V'
b'To every military and veteran spouse, caregiver, and survivor \xe2\x80\x93 with all my heart: thank you for your service and your sacrifice. https://t.co/fGqCqHExrd'

b'Today marked a historic moment for our military community \xe2\x80\x93 and there was no better place for Joe to sign an Executive Order to strengthen our support for  military-connected spouses than at Fort Liberty, home to the largest spouse population among our armed forces. https://t.co/nbcSCDtXDe'
b'Thank you to military spouses everywhere for sharing their stories \xe2\x80\x94 and trusting us to find solutions to support their careers.\n\nThis moment belongs to our military community.'

b'As a military family, this is personal to Joe and me. We know service does not end when uniforms are put away.\n\nThat\xe2\x80\x99s why this Executive Order extends to veteran spouses, caregivers, and survivors.'

b'Joe\xe2\x80\x99s Executive Order strengthens the federal government\xe2\x80\x99s ability to recruit, hire, and retain military and veteran spouses, caregivers, and survivors.\n\nFrom improving telework opportunities to expanding options for child care \xe2\x80\x94 today marks an important step forward.'

b'Our service members shouldn\xe2\x80\x99t have to choose between their love of our country and their love of family.\n\nSupporting our military-connected spouses \xe2\x80\x94 and this Executive Order \xe2\x80\x94 are matters of national security.'

b'Through my Joining Forces initiative, I\xe2\x80\x99ve met with military-connected spouses across the country and around the world to hear how we can better support their careers.  \n\nWe brought their stories back to the White House \xe2\x80\x94 and Joe listened. https://t.co/OmtM8H0jVg'

They were innovative, brave, and reminded me of the possibility for young people around the world.\n\nThrough\xc2\xa0the @MCCgov, the U.S. and Morocco have expanded opportunities for the next generation to learn and grow. https://t.co/ktY7Cuxpy8'

b'The incredible women leaders I met in Jordan are starting businesses, investing in communities, and building confidence in the next generation of young women.\n\nI was reminded that when women get the opportunities we deserve, there\xe2\x80\x99s no limit to what we can do. https://t.co/qZLPADOMQq'

b'Government to government, people to people, and heart to heart, we will continue to strengthen our relationships in the region and reaffirm our commitment to the future of young people around the world.'

b'In a time when we often struggle to find common ground, investing in our workforce brings Americans together. And together, we are rebuilding our infrastructure, advancing our clean energy future, and revitalizing our manufacturing right here at home.'
b"Second, the Administration will work to expand advanced manufacturing training programs across the country \xe2\x80\x93 a sector that is growing because of Joe's Investing in America agenda."

b'First, we\xe2\x80\x99re launching Workforce Hubs, starting in five cities: Phoenix, AZ, Columbus, OH, Baltimore, MD, Pittsburgh, PA, and Augusta, GA.\n\nWe are bringing together local leaders, employers, unions, and community colleges to expand training pathways for good-paying jobs.'

b"Joe and his Administration know a four-year degree isn\xe2\x80\x99t the only path to a good-paying job.\n\nThat\xe2\x80\x99s why I was excited to join @USDOL's Workforce Convening to announce new Investing in America initiatives that will help people gain the skills needed for in-demand careers."
